page.title: 16NENE VALLEY STEAM CENTRE
page.content: The Nene Valley Steam Centre is a major tourist attraction with its large collection of old steam trains. The trains run from Wansford to just east of Ferry Meadows Country Park, but in 1986 the railway will run right through Peterborough, taking people to the city centre. The trains at Wansford come from places all over the world. The station employs two permanent fitters, a manager and two other workers. All other workers are volunteers. They have tried to create an atmosphere of the past in the station. One of the volunteers comes from Stamford, the other 2 from Peterborough. The manager at Wansford has been in tourism for 15 years, 13 of which have been at Nene Valley. The station's profits are Â£500, all of which are donated to a registered charity.
